data.title: June 20, 2001
data.meta_description: Paddock, Dolly, 63, of Warwick, died Tuesday, June 19, 2001 in Warwick. Strong-Basile Funeral Home, 986-4632 \n Tranquille, Fequiere \
data.text:
Paddock, Dolly, 63, of Warwick, died

Tuesday, June 19, 2001 in Warwick.

Strong-Basile Funeral Home, 986-4632

Tranquille, Fequiere "Walter", 19, of

Monticello, died Saturday, June 16, 2001.

Applebee-McPhillips Funeral Home. 343-6309.

Grant, David G., 84, of Salisbury Mills,

died Sunday, June 17, 2001 in Cornwall.

White & Venuto Funeral Home. 562-6550.

Werner, Adeline, 86, of Warwick, died

Monday, June 18, 2001 in Goshen.

Strong-Basile Funeral Home. 986-4632.

Faulds, James, 70, of Westbrookville, died

Sunday, June 17, 2001. Applebee-McPhillips

Funeral Home. 343-6309.

Ulrichs, Beatrice M., 58, of

Cuddebackville, died Monday, June 18, 2001,

in Valhalla. Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home.

856-3312.

Paddock, Elsie, 75, of New Hampton, died

Monday, June 18, 2001. Lazear-Smith &

VanderPlaat Memorial Home, 986-4331

Tamlyn, Bruce O., 74, of Manchester

Township, N.J. died Sunday, June 17, 2001,

in Lakewood, N.J. Quinn-Hopping Funeral

Home. 732-240-3800.

Music, Morris Simon, 85, of Kerhonkson,

died Tuesday, June 19, 2001 in Kerhonkson.

Joseph N. Garlick Funeral Home. 794-7474.

Watt, Kathryn, M. 94, of the Town of

Newburgh, died Friday, June 15, 2001, in

Largo Fla. Perrott-Berardinelli Home For

Funerals, Inc. 562-7300.

Kunowski, Walter T., 46, of Dingman's

Ferry, Pa., died Saturday, June 16, 2001,

in East Stroudsburg, Pa. Stroyan Funeral

Home. 570-296-6811.

Barnes, Jeannette A., 89, of Beach Lake,

Pa. died Monday, June 18, 2001, in Beach

Lake, Pa. Rasmussen Sons Funeral Home.

252-3901.

Hennessy, Alice M. 69, of Lady Lake,

Florida died Saturday, June 16, 2001 in

Florida. Smith, Seaman & Quackenbush

Funeral Home, 845-782-8185

Breski, Adam M. 85, of Central Valley, died

Monday, June 18, 2001. Smith, Seaman &

Quackenbush Funeral Home, 845-782-8185

Drake, Oletha May (nee Predmore), 82, of

Cartersville, Ga. died Sunday, June 17,

2001, in Cartersville, Ga. Ferguson Funeral

Home. 973-875-4941.

Sherman, Walter A., 70, of Smallwood and

formerly of Staten Island, died Sunday,

June 17, 2001 in Valhalla. Casey Funeral

Home. 718 447-4242.

Ford, Mrs. Sena, 102, of Holland, Michigan,

died Monday, June 18, 2001 in Michigan.

Gray-Parker Funeral Home. 856-5191.

Fehsal, Glendora M. "Dorey", 59, of

Livingston Manor, died Tuesday, June 19,

2001, in Harris. Herbert C. Bryant Funeral

Home. 439-4333.

ADDENDUMA memorial service for Ralph Cleveland

Morhous and Alicia Parker Morhous will be

held at 10:30 a.m. on Saturday, June 23, at

Cornwall Methodist Church, Main Street,

Cornwall. Survivors include two daughters,

Mary Elizabeth Scheels aznd son-in-law

Richard Scheels of McLean, VA and Sara Ann

Montillier and son-in-law Jean-Pierre

Montillier of Westport, CT; and one son,

Steven Parker Morhous and daughter-in-law

Kathy Ann Morhous of Milton; 11

grandchildren, three great-grandchildren,

one sister Evelyn Rayfield of Newark, two

nephews and one niece.

DOLLY PADDOCK

Warwick, N.Y.Dolly Paddock, a ward clerk at St.

Anthony's Hospital in Warwick, and a 40

year area resident, entered into rest

Tuesday, June 19, 2001 in St. Anthony's

Hospital, Warwick. She was 63.The daughter of Ernest and Edith Rogers

Behrens, she was born December 9, 1937 in

Manhattan.Survivors include her husband, Robert

Paddock at home; four sons, James Ryan of

Tuckerton, N.J., Eugene Ryan of Aurora,

Co., Darryl Ryan and Edward Pastori, both

of Denver, Co.; and three grandchildren.Services will be private and at the

convenience of the family.In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be made to St. Anthony's Hospital,

Grand St., Warwick, N.Y. 10990.Funeral arrangements entrusted to the

Strong-Basile Funeral Home, Warwick.

MRS. SENA FORD

Holland, MichiganMrs. Sena Ford of Holland, Michigan, a

retired tailor, passed away on Monday, June

18, 2001 at the Pine Wood Christian Home in

Holland. She was 102.She was born November 11, 1898 in Holland,

Michigan.She was the widow of the late Harry Ford.Survivors include two daughters, Elaine F.

Cofill and her husband the Rev. Richard V.

Coffill, former pastor of the Deerpark

Reformed Church of Port Jervis, now

residing in Holland, Mich., and Wilma

Sullivan and her husband James of Hernando,

Florida; five grandchildren, Randall

Coffill of Pine Bush, Gretchen Narvarte of

Matamoras, PA, Harry Ford Coffill of E.

Grand Rapids, Mich., Steven Sullivan of

North Carolina and Douglas Sullivan of

Cleveland, OH and five

great-grandchildren.Funeral services and burial will be held

on Wednesday, June 20, in Holland, Mich.Local arrangements under the direction of

Gray-Parker Funeral Home, Port Jervis.

OLETHA MAY DRAKE (NEE PREDMORE)

Cartersville, Ga.Oletha May Drake (nee Predmore), of

Cartersville, Ga. and former 42-year

resident of Sussex, N.J. died Sunday, June

17, 2001, after a long illness in

Emory-Cartersville Medical Center, Ga. She

was 82.The daughter of the late Roy and Ethel

Predmore, in Orange County.She was the widow of Charles Drake.Mrs. Drake was a member of the Glenwood

Baptist Church in Glenwood, N.J.Survivors include one son, Robert Pfleger

of Pinniellas Park, Fla.; three

grandchildren, Michele Fischer of

Cartersville, Ga., Ernie Pfleger of

Middletown, and Holly Koziel of

Cartersville, Ga.; and seven

great-grandchildren.Family will receive friends form 7 to 9

p.m. Thursday, June 21, at Ferguson Funeral

Home, 27 Third St., Sussex, N.J.Funeral services will be held at 10 a.m.

Friday, June 22, at the funeral home.Interment will follow in Glenwood

Cemetery, Glenwood, N.J.Funeral arrangements were made by Ferguson

Funeral home.

ADELINE WERNER

Goshen, N.Y.Adeline Werner, a retired nurse at Orange

County Infirmary and 43 year resident of

the area, died Monday, June 18, 2001 at

Arden Hill Hospital. She was 86.The daughter of Vincent and Marietta

Delzio Pugliese, she was born October 13,

1915 in New York City. She is the widow of

Theodore H. Werner, Sr.,Survivors include two sons, Theodore H.

Werner, Jr. of Eldred and William A. Werner

of Plymouth; two grandchildren, Roy and

Desiree; one brother, William Pugliese from

the State of Florida and one sister,

Eleanor Briganti of Norwalk, CT.She was predeceased by two grandchildren,

Christopher and Mary and two brothers,

Albert and Michael.There will be no visitation.There will be a graveside service at —

p.m. on Thursday, June 21, at Warwick

Cemetery. The Rev. Elwood Mather will

officiate.Memorial donations may be made to Cystic

Fibrosis Foundation, 6931 Arlington Road,

Bethesda, MD 20814.Funeral arrangements entrusted to

Strong-Basile Funeral Home.

DAVID G. GRANT

Salisbury Mills, N.Y.David G. Grant of Salisbury Mills, died

Sunday, June 17, 2001 at Cornwall

Hospital. He was 84.The son of the late George and Valeska

Grant he was born September 10, 1916 in

Saskatchewan, Canada.Mr. Grant was a retired fund raiser for

Family Counseling in Newburgh. Prior to

that he was employed by The American Cancer

Society, American Diabetes Association and

The Girl Scouts of America. He was a

member of the City of Newburgh Lions Club

and a great supporter of the People To

People Fund.Survivors include his wife Suzanne

Leguillon Grant; two sons, Ken Grant of

Astoria and Jeffrey Grant of Loch

Sheldrake; one daughter, Diane Melnik of

Town of Plattekill; one brother, Gerald

Grant of Escondido, CA; one niece and one

nephew.The family will receive friends from 5 to

8 p.m. on Wednesday, June 20, at White &

Venuto Funeral Home, 188 North Plank Road,

Newburgh.Cremation will take place Thursday, June

21, at Cedar Hill Crematory.Arrangements under the direction of White

& Venuto Funeral Home.

MORRIS SIMON MUSIC

Kerhonkson, N.Y.Morris Simon Music, a retired Sgt. with

the Sullivan County Sheriff's Department

with both Road Patrol and Corrections and

longtime area resident, died Tuesday, June

19, 2001, at home. He was 85.He was born December 22, 1915 in Long

Branch, NJ.Survivors include two daughters, Sheryl

Butler and her husband Donnel of Kerhonkson

and Barbara Music and her husband Peter

McIntyre of Florida; four grandchildren,

Brian and Trisha Butler, Penny Vaughn and

Gino Gentile, one great-granddaughter,

Cassie Vaughn; five nieces, Beverly

Catalano, Leslie and Marsha Music, Carol

Benkowitz, and Susan Morse; seven nephews,

Joel Benkowitz, Charles Robert Zank, Allan,

Stanley, Steven, Lorenzo, and Richard

Music; one great-nephew, Danny Catalano;

and several great nieces and nephews

throughout the country.Services will be at 10 a.m. on Thursday,

June 21, at Congregation Ezrath Israel

Synagogue, Ellenville. Rabbi Moshe Frank

will officiate.Burial will be in Cedar Park Cemetery,

Westwood, NJ.Arrangements under the direction of Joseph

N. Garlick Funeral Home.

FEQUIERE "WALTER" TRANQUILLE

Monticello, N.Y.

Fequiere "Walter" Tranquille of Monticello,

a lifelong resident of the Middletown area,

entered into eternal life on Saturday, June

16, 2001. He was 19.The son of Fequiere and the late Sylfine

Casimer Tranquille, he was born Aug. 3,

1981, in Suffern.Walter was a graduate of Fallsburg High

School; and a student at Sylvan Learning

Center in Middletown.A family statement read: "He was a very

spiritual, loving and caring brother, son

and uncle who was loved by many people."Survivors include his father at home;

three brothers, Stevenson at home,

Mikerlange "Michael" of Fallsburg, and

Dwayn of Spring Valley; two sisters,

Shirlene at home and Tachnicka of Spring

Valley; one uncle, Wilfred; four aunts,

Carmen, Anne, Jacqueline, and Cleonne; and

one nephew, Nacquan.Friends may cal from 7 to 9 p.m. Friday,

June 22, at Applebee-McPhillips Funeral

Home, 130 Highland Ave., Middletown.A Mass of Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 9:30 a.m. Saturday, June 23,

in St. Joseph's Church, Cottage Street,

Middletown.Interment will follow in Wallkill

Cemetery, Phillipsburgh.Funeral arrangements were made by

Applebee-McPhillips Funeral Home.

ELSIE PADDOCK

New Hampton, N.Y.Elsie Paddock of New Hampton, and former

longtime resident of Warwick, N.Y. and

Manchester, England, died Monday, June 18,

2001 after a short illness. She was 75.The daughter of the late Jessie Scott and

Frederick Owens, she was born June 17, 1926

in Manchester, England.She was a retired seamstress for City

Surgical of New York City. Survivors include one son, Richard Paddock

and his wife, Patricia of Warwick; one

daughter, Eileen Pavlik and her husband,

David of New Hampton; her grandchildren,

Richard Eric Paddoc and his wife, Katherine

Brands of Warwick, Jennifer Lynn Paddock of

Watertown, Ct., and Carolyn and Mark Pavlik

of New Hampton; her greatgranddauther,

Jenna Otano of Watertown, Ct.; and dozens

of nephews and nieces.She was predeceased by her husband,

Richard Paddock; her sister, Marion Crosby;

and her brothers, Frank, Harry and John

Owens.Cremation and arrangements were under the

direction of Lazear-Smith & VanderPlaat

Memorial Home of Warwick. Funeral services

will be private and at the convenience of

the family. In lieu of flowers, please make memorial

contributions to the charity of one's

choice.

WALTER T. KUNOWSKI, Jr.

Dingman's Ferry, Pa.Walter T. Kunowski, Jr. of Dingman's

Ferry, Pa., a truck driver for Dutchess

Terminals in Poughkeepsie, died Saturday,

June 16, 2001, in Pocono Medical Center,

East Stroudsburg, Pa. He was 46.The son of the late Walter T. Kunowski,

Sr. and Helen Jankowski Kunowski, he was

born Febrary 9, 1955, in Newburgh.He was a member of the Teamsters Union,

Local #338.Survivors include his wife, Terry Soit, at

home; two daughters, Caryn Jane Kunowski of

Warwick and Alexis Raine Kunowski at home;

one son, Ryan Robert Soit at home; two

brothers, John Kunowski of Boston, Mass.

and Peter Kunowski of California; and many

nieces and nephews.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 8

p.m. today, Wednesday, June 20, 2001, in

First Presbyterian Church, 308 Broad St.,

Milford, Pa.Funeral services will be held at 8 p.m.

tonight, Wednesday, June 20, at the First

Presbyterian Church with the Rev. Benjamin

Willis officiating.At the conclusion of the services, the

family welcomes everyone to the First

Presbyterian Church fellowship hall.Interment will be private at the

convenience of the family in Milford

Cemetery, Dingman Township, Pa.Arrangements are by the Stroyan Funeral

Home, 405 West Harford St., Milford, Pa.

WALTER A. SHERMAN

Smallwood, N.Y.Walter A. Sherman, of Smallwood, died

Sunday, June 17, 2001 at Westchester

Medical Center, Valhalla. He was 70.Mr. Sherman was born and raised on Staten

Island and moved to Smallwood in 1996.Mr. Sherman had a 38 year career in the

International Banking Division of American

Express as an assistant treasurer for the

last five years. He retired in 1988.After completing his high school education

at Manlius Military School, he received a

scholarship from the school to study at the

Rossall School, Fleetwood Lance, England

for one year.He served in the National Guard, 42nd

Infantry, stationed in Manhattan from 1951

to 1958 and achieved the rank of first

sergeant.Mr. Sherman was a member of the Randall

Manor Residents Association for many years

and also belonged to the Parents Club of

St. Peter's Boys High School.

Survivors include his wife of 45 years, the

former Kathryn Bridger and two sons,

William T. and Richard E.The funeral service will be at — p.m. on

Thursday, June 21, at Casey Funeral Home,

Castleton Corners, Staten Island.Private cremation will be in Rosehill

Crematory, Linden, NJ.Arrangements under the direction of Casey

Funeral Home.

JAMES FAULDS

Westbrookville, N.Y.James Faulds of Wesbrookville, a retired

auto mechanic and bar manager, and former

Brooklyn resident, passed away Sunday, June

17, 2001, at home. He was 70.The son of the late Samuel J. and Mary

Sweeney Faulds, he was born June 9, 1931,

in Glasgow, Scotland.Mr. Faulds served in the United States

Army during the Korean War from 1952 to

1954.He moved to Westbrookville from Brooklyn

with his family 10 years ago. James was a

proud and private family oriented man who

will be sorely missed by his devoted wife,

children and grandchildren.Survivors include his beloved wife,

Margaret Faulds; three sons, James and his

wife, Cathleen, Kenneth and his wife, Mary

and Andrew; one daughter, Margaret and her

husband, Thomas; one brother; one sister,

Margaret; and six grandchildren, Margaret,

Courtney, Kenneth, Heather, Emily and

Lauren.There will be no visitation.A Memorial Mass will be celebrated at 7:30

p.m. Thursday, June 21, in St. Joseph's

Roman Catholic Church, 149 Cottage Street,

Middletown and at — p.m. Monday, June 25,

in Our Lady of Angels Church, 7340 Fourth

Ave., Brooklyn.Memorial contributions in James' name may

be made to Citizens Reunited to Overcome

Cancer, 9 Charlotte Mews, Middletown, N.Y.

10940.Funeral arrangements were made by

Applebee-McPhillips Funeral Home.

GLENDORA M. "DOREY" FEHSAL

Livingston Manor, N.Y.Glendora M. "Dorey" Fehsal of Livingston

Manor, a clerk at the Ultra Power,

Parksville, and lifetime resident of the

area, died Tuesday, June 19, 2001, in

Community General Hospital, Harris. She was

59.The daughter of the late Sidney and Ruby

Price Felix, she was born July 31, 1941, in

Potsdam.A family statement read: "She was a loving

wife, mother, stepmother and grandmother."Survivors include her husband, James E.

Fehsal at home; four sons, Harry Patton and

his wife, Nancy of Harris, Billy Patton of

Illinois, Kevin Patton and his companion,

Sherry Masker of Loch Sheldrake and Steve

Patton and his companion, Angie Detzauer of

Loch Sheldrake; four daughters, Skye

Fehsal-Wilbur and her husband, James of

Liberty, Ann Winter and her husband,

Charlie of Loch Sheldrake, Sue Fehsal of

Loch Sheldrake and Daun Sees of Buffalo;

and 21 grandchildren.She was predeceased by one son, James

Patton.Visitation will be from 6 to 8 p.m.

Thursday, June 21, at Herbert C. Bryan

Funeral Home, 29 Pearl St., Livingston

Manor.Funeral services will follow at 8 p.m. at

the funeral home. Pastor Dorothy Smith will

officiate.Private cremation will be in Cedar Hill

Crematory, Newburgh.In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be sent to Livingston Manor Volunteer

Ambulance Corps., P.O. Box 1, Livingston

Manor, N.Y. 12758.Funeral arrangements were made by Herbert

C. Bryant Funeral Home.

ALICE M. HENNESSY

Lady Lake, FloridaAlice M. Hennessy, a retired aide for

Monroe-Woodury High School, Central Valley,

a seven year resident of Florida and a

former twenty-five year resident of Monroe,

died Saturday, June 16, 2001 in Leesburg

Regional Medical Center, Leesburg, Florida.

She was 69.The daughter of the late John and Jane Hay

Brush, she was born May 31, 1932 in New

York City.She was a member of the Sacred Heart R.C.

Church, Monroe.Survivors include her husband, Bernard J.

Hennessy of Lady Lake, Fl.; four sons,

James E. Hennessy of New Market, MD, Daniel

G. Hennessy of Greensburg, Pa., John B.

Hennessy of Clinton, Ct., and Andrew J.

Hennessy of Newburgh; two brothers, George

E. Brush of Jaffrey, NH, and John D. Brush

of Poughkeepsie; nine grandchildren and

several nieces and nephews.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. on Thursday, June 21, 2001 at Smith,

Seaman & Quackenbush Funeral Home, 117

Maple Ave., Monroe. A prayer service will

be held at 8 p.m. on Thursday, June 21 at

the funeral home. A funeral mass will be celebrated at 10

a.m. on Friday, June 22 in Sacred Heart

R.C. Church, 26 Still Rd., Monroe. Burial will be in St. Anastasia Cemetery,

Harriman.Memorial contributions may be made to the

Alzheimer's Assoc., 2 Jefferson Plaza,

Suite 102, Poughkeepsie, NY 12601.Funeral services are under the direction

of Smith, Seaman & Quackenbush Funeral

Home.

BEATRICE M. ULRICHS

Cuddebackville, N.Y.Beatrice M. Ulrichs of Cuddebackville, a

retired supervisor for Novelty Slipper Co.,

Port Jervis, and lifelong resident of the

area, died Monday, June 18, 2001, in

Westchester Medical Center, Valhalla. She

was 58.The daughter of the late Wilbur Southard

and Martha Kishpaul Southard, she was born

July 28, 1942, in Stillwater, N.J.She was the widow of Kenneth F. Ulrichs,

who passed away March 7, 1999.A family statement read: "Beatrice was a

loving, caring woman. She will be missed by

everyone who knew her. She loved to play

Bingo and scratch off instant lotto

tickets."Survivors include one daughter, Sharon

Reyes and her husband, David of Huguenot;

four sons, Gary Ulrichs and his wife,

Bonnie of Cuddebackville, Ronald Ulrichs

and his fiancee, Pam of Huguenot, Robert

Ulrichs and his wife, Denise of

Sparrowbush, and Michael Ulrichs and his

wife, Pam of Godeffroy; one brother, Harold

Southard and his wife, Shirley of Montague,

N.J.; 17 grandchildren; four

great-grandchildren; and several nieces and

nephews.She was predeceased by four brothers,

Pete, Frederick, Earl and Alber; and three

sisters, Katherine, Barbara and Hazel.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. today, Wednesday, June 20, at

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, 154 E. Main

St., Port Jervis.Funeral services will be held at 10:30

a.m. Thursday, June 21, at the funeral

home. The Rev. Don Coy will officiate.Burial will be in Quarry Hill Cemetery,

Rio.Funeral arrangements were made by

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home.

ADAM M. BRESKI

Central Valley, N.Y.Adam M. Breski, a retired employee of the

United States Post Office in Queens and a

eleven year resident, died Monday, June 18,

2001 in Ramapo Manor Nursing Home, Airmont,

N.Y. He was 85.The son of the late Bronislaus and MaryAnn

Rakowski Breski, he was born December 2,

1915 in Elmhurst.He was a member of St. Patrick's R.C.

Church, Highland Mills, the Woodbury Golden

Agers, and the St. Adalberts Holy Name

Society of Queens.Survivors include his wife, Frances Breski

of Central Valley, two sons, Rev. Martin

Breski, Pastor of All Saints Parish in

Boswell, Pa. and Thomas Breski of Elmhurst;

two daughters, Therese Philipp and her

husband, David of Raleigh, N.C. and Mary

Moroney and her husband, T.J of Highland

Mills, one brother, Henry Breski of

Farmingdale; two sisters, Helen Smul of

Elmhurst and Agnes Kruzynski of Toms River,

N.J.; four grandsons, Kenneth Philipp, T.J.

Moroney, Sean Moroney and Scott Moroney;

one granddaughter, Christina Connolly; and

two great-grandchildren, Zachary Connolly

and Jake Connolly; and several nieces and

nephews.Friends may call from 7 to 9 p.m. on

Tuesday, June 19 and from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. on Wednesday, June 20, 2001 at Smith,

Seaman & Quackenbush, Inc., 515 Route 32,

Highland Mills. A prayer service will be

held at 8 p.m., Wednesday, June 20 at the

funeral home.A funeral mass will be celebrated 10 a.m.,

Thursday, June 21 in St. Patrick's Church,

26 Hunter St., Highland Mills. The Rev.

Martin Breski will officiate. Burial will be in Cemetery of the

Highlands, Highland Mills. Memorial contributions may be made to

Franciscan Mission Association, Grandy,

Massachusetts.Funeral arrangements are under the

direction of Smith, Seaman & Quackenbush

Funeral Home.

BRUCE O. TAMLYN

Manchester Township, N.J.Bruce O. Tamlyn of Manchester Township,

N.J. a retired Regional Manager of

Personnel for GMAC, New York City, and

14-year resident of the area and former

Ho-Ho-Kus resident, died Sunday, June 17,

2001, in Kimball Medical Center, Lakewood,

N.J. He was 74.He was born in Brooklyn.Mr. Tamlyn graduated from Poly Prep,

Brooklyn in 1943 and Yale University, New

Haven, Conn. in 1946, with a BA Degree.

Bruce was a U.S. Navy Lieutenant, having

served during WWII from 1944 to 1946 and

from 1946 to 1962 he served in the Navy

Reserve. He was a member of Pinelands

Reformed Church, Toms River and previously

Old Paramus Reformed Church, where he

served as an Elder and a member of the

choir in both churches. When his children

were small, he was involved in the town

youth programs as well as the Boy Scouts of

America. He was very active in Leisure

Village West...he was a director of the

Viston, Inc. which is a senior services

organization and he sat on the Board there

for 12-years. He was involved in the TV

station LVW-TV where he conducted local

interviews. He was very active in fund

raising for the LVW chapter of the Deborah

Foundation.Survivors include his wife of 50-years,

Nancy (nee) Wray Tamlyn of Manchester

Township; three sons, Rev. W. Bruce Tamlyn

of Silver Bay, Rev. Keith Tamlyn of

Wallkill, Richard Tamlyn of Sherman Oaks,

Calif., and their families including four

grandchildren; and one brother-in-law,

L.Gates Wray of Midland Park, N.J.Family will receive friends from 9:30 a.m.

to 11 am. Saturday, June 23, in Pinelands

Reformed Church, 898 Route 37 West, Toms

River, N.J.A Memorial service will follow at 11 a.m.

Saturday, June 23, in the church.Memorial contributions may be made to

Wallkill Reformed Church.Funeral arrangements were made by

Quinn-Hopping Funeral Home, 26 Mule Road,

Toms River, N.J.

JEANNETTE A. BARNES

Beach Lake, Pa.Jeannette A. Barnes of Beach Lake, Pa., a

homemaker and former co-owner of the Brick

House Antique Shop, Narrowsburg and

lifetime resident of the area and former

Narrowsburg resident, died Monday, June 18,

2001, at Murray-Tufts Garret Manor, Beach

Lake, Pa. She was 89.The daughter of the late John and Nina

Bedford Anderson, she was born March 8,

1912, in Narrowsburg.She was the widow of David Barnes, who

passed away in 1977.Mrs. Barnes was a lifelong, dedicate

member of the Narrowsburg United Methodist

Church as well as a member of the United

Methodist Women of the church. A family statement read: "She was

interested in the history of the area and

an avid reader of newspapers, magazines and

books. She loved her family, especially her

five grandchildren and five

great-grandchildren, and with the help of

friends, was able to keep active in the

Murry-Tufts Garret Manor where she had

resided for 23-years."Survivors include one son, John Barnes and

his wife, Marion of Elma;; one

daughter-in-law, Barbara Barnes of

Lackawaxen, Pa.; five grandchildren, Marie,

Jeffrey, Keith, Joseph and Kenny; five

great-grandchildren, David, Curtis,

Jeannine, Savanna and Samantha; and two

nephews, Gordon and Robert Tyler.She was predeceased by one son, Edward;

one sister, Gertrude Tyler; and one

brother, Lamont Anderson.Visitation will be from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. today, Wednesday, June 20, at

Rasmussen Sons Funeral Home, Narrowsburg.Funeral services will be held at 10:30

a.m. Thursday, June 21, in Narrowsburg

United Methodist Church, Narrowsburg. The

Rev. Steven Knutsen will officiate.Interment will be in Glen Cove Cemetery,

Narrowsburg.Memorial contributions may be made to the

Narrowsburg United Methodist Church,

Narrowsburg, N.Y. 12764.Funeral arrangements under the direction

of Rasmussen Sons Funeral Home.

KATHRYN M. WATT

Town of Newburgh, N.Y.Kathryn M. Watt, of the Town of Newburgh,

died Friday, June 15, 2001 at Beverly

Health Care, Largo, Fla. She was 94.The daughter of the late James McCoach and

Margaret Peel, she was born November 27,

1906 in New York.She was married to the late Thomas Craig

Watt. She attended Newburgh Free Academy,

and completed her schooling in Northfield

Seminary in Massachusetts. She was an

Ordained Elder of the First United

Presbyterian Church and a member of the

Union Presbyterian Church. As a singer in

Church Choirs from the age of 14 she also

sang with Avis Lawton's Choral Group and

the Town of Newburgh Golden Songsters. She

was the Founder and First President of the

Union Grove School PTA, a Red Cross

Volunteer during WWII, Past Chief Daughter

of Lady Fraser Lodge, Daughter of Scotia

and Chaplain of the Town of Newburgh Golden

Ages

"Her family and her Faith came first in her

life. She was a loving, devoted wife,

mother and great grandmother. She had a

strong Faith all her life and often said,

"I just put myself in the Lord's Hands."She was a longtime resident of Newburgh.Survivors include one son James C. and

wife Mary Ann Watt of Seminole, Fla; two

daughters Kathryn Heyel of Glassboro, NJ,

Margaret Williamson and her fiance Robert

Wells of the Town of Newburgh; ten

grandchildren, Thomas J. Watt, Linda Anne

Lambert, Susan H. Recine, Mary Ann Wilson,

Diane K. Halstead, Kathryn L. Harter, James

C. Watt, Jr, Mari Kay Heyel-Matteo, John G.

Watt and David C. Heyel; fourteen great

grandchildren and many nieces and nephews.Predeceased by three sisters and one

granddaughterVisitation will be from 7 to 9 p.m. on

Home for Funerals, One Grand Avenue,

Newburgh.Services will be held at 10 a.m. on

Balmville Road, NewburghBurial will be in Woodlawn Cemetery, New
